result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob M Arendt

defendant.name: Arendt, Jacob M
defendant.address: 8821 South Wood Creek Drive #10, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob M Arendt in court.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court adopts the findings on case 22CM2231 and found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Dan Adams to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate $50.00 per month beginning on at the conclusion of the case and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacob M Arendt in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has requested an offer from the State. Case is passed to allow the defendant to speak with the State. 

***
Recalled at 10:18 AM. Appearances remain the same. Case is retabbed to Branch 41. State cannot provide an offer without speaking with victims. Case is adjourned in Branch 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KRI.Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jacob M Arendt appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for Jacob M Arendt.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Triggiano, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
